item.title: Learning New Things
item.itunes:summary: <![CDATA[In this episode we talk about learning new things. We discuss what got us interested in software in the first place, and how those original motivations still color how we approach learning. Should we learn new things just because we read about them on Hacker News? Should we dive deep and become an expert in a field, or is it just more fun to do new and different things?]>

item.title: Code Review
item.itunes:summary: <![CDATA[In this episode, we talk about version control systems, pull requests, asynchronous work, automated checks, and accepting criticism. We also cover all possible parts of code review - early pull requests, pre-review comments, diff review, and manual testing.]>

item.title: Code Comments
item.itunes:summary: <![CDATA[How often should you leave code comments? Is it necessarily a failure to express yourself clearly in the code? Are code comments the best way to communicate with your team? Are your comments helpful, or just cathartic?]>

item.title: YAGNI
item.itunes:summary: <![CDATA[Are you building custom software? Are you adding extra features to work tool? Maybe You Arent Gonna Need It. In this episode we debate using off the shelf software vs. building your own. Is your company actually selling software? What is your business model? We also discuss unnecessary complexity in software and the impact this can have on quality.]>

item.title: Points
item.itunes:summary: <![CDATA[What are points in Software Developement? Join our hosts as we discuss how points can both useful and harmful when developing. In this episode we cover what points are, their relationship to velocity and how they help with estimates.]>
